result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec J Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alec J Ray is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alec J Ray was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Alec J Ray was found guilty of Poss Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/ Minor Pass < 16 yrs.)

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alec J Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Balance Due

ADDRESS INFO for Alec J Ray
Current: 618 Woodard Ave, Tomah, WI 54660 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2016)
Prior: 12655 Katydid Ave, Sparta, WI 54656

2:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 and 4 being amended to a county ordinance 130-1 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 4 as amended to county ordinance 130-1 and orders count 1 be dismissed outright and count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Count 2

-5 days county jail, with huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$350 Fine and court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
-Blood Draw Fee $42.50
-DL revocation - 12 months
-AODA and any follow-up(Monroe)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Count 4 

$200 Forfeiture plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 3:07 p.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:39 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has an offer and needs to follow-up with a couple of things.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:40 a.m.
Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:30 am.

9:07 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 14, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
